page.title: 12THE MILL, BERKELEY VALE (1)
page.content: Built in the late 18th century on the{Berkeley Castle Estate,}Sea Mills, as it was known then, was a water powered{grist mill}for the castle. In 1967 when Berkeley Power station was built and the land around was drained, the mill lost its water and so is now{electrically driven. The mill, known now as Englands Mills, {Stoneground Flour Millers,}produces real flours with{no chemical additives and other products such as muesli, bran and wheatgerm. The{small mill}is making a{comeback}due to the eating habits of today. The larger mills such as Spillers in Avonmouth are making cutbacks in white flour consumption and so many ex-large-mill-workers are {redeveloping the small mills,}such as this one. The mill has a workforce of five incuding the owner and his daughter.
